text: {"data":{"codelists":[{"annotations":[{"id":"origin","value":"INTEGRATION"},{"id":"isFinal"},{"id":"lastUpdatedAt","value":"2025-03-29T18:39:25.173423Z"}],"id":"CL_FD_INDICATOR","name":"Fiscal Decentralization (FD) Indicator","names":{"en":"Fiscal Decentralization (FD) Indicator"},"descriptions":{},"version":"2.0.0","agencyID":"IMF.STA","isPartial":false,"codes":[{"annotations":[],"id":"G2MD_PT","name":"Expenditure decentralization (ratio of own spending to general government spending), Percent","names":{"en":"Expenditure decentralization (ratio of own spending to general government spending), Percent"},"description":"A measure of expenditure decentralization, calculated as the ratio of sub-national government spending to general government spending over a specific period. This ratio indicates the distribution of spending authority between different levels of government. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"A measure of expenditure decentralization, calculated as the ratio of sub-national government spending to general government spending over a specific period. This ratio indicates the distribution of spending authority between different levels of government. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"TRANSFERDEP1_R_NT_OS_PT","name":"Transfer dependency method 1, Ratio of net transfers to own spending, Percent","names":{"en":"Transfer dependency method 1, Ratio of net transfers to own spending, Percent"},"description":"A method used to calculate the dependency of a government entity on transfer payments from other entities. Ratio comparing a government's net transfers to its total spending. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"A method used to calculate the dependency of a government entity on transfer payments from other entities. Ratio comparing a government's net transfers to its total spending. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"TRANSFERDEP2_R_NT_OR_PT","name":"Transfer dependency method 2, Ratio of net transfers to own revenue, Percent","names":{"en":"Transfer dependency method 2, Ratio of net transfers to own revenue, Percent"},"description":"An alternative method used to calculate the dependency of a government entity on transfer payments from other entities. Proportion of a government's net transfers relative to its own revenue. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"An alternative method used to calculate the dependency of a government entity on transfer payments from other entities. Proportion of a government's net transfers relative to its own revenue. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"DEFICIT_POOS_PT","name":"Deficit, Percent of own spending","names":{"en":"Deficit, Percent of own spending"},"description":"The amount by which a government's total expenditures exceed its total revenues in a specific period, leading to a shortfall that must be financed through borrowing. Indicates the proportion of specific budget categories within total spending. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"The amount by which a government's total expenditures exceed its total revenues in a specific period, leading to a shortfall that must be financed through borrowing. Indicates the proportion of specific budget categories within total spending. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"G63G_POOR_PT","name":"Gross debt, Percent of own revenue","names":{"en":"Gross debt, Percent of own revenue"},"description":"Gross debt is the sum of all liabilities that are debt instruments.  Debt instruments are financial instruments that require the payment of principal and/or interest at some point(s) in the future. Debt instruments consist of SDRs, currency and deposits, debt securities, loans, insurance technical reserves, pension and related entitlements, provision for calls under standardized guarantees, and other accounts receivable/payable.  Refers to expenses or specific variables as a percentage of total own revenue generated. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"Gross debt is the sum of all liabilities that are debt instruments.  Debt instruments are financial instruments that require the payment of principal and/or interest at some point(s) in the future. Debt instruments consist of SDRs, currency and deposits, debt securities, loans, insurance technical reserves, pension and related entitlements, provision for calls under standardized guarantees, and other accounts receivable/payable.  Refers to expenses or specific variables as a percentage of total own revenue generated. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"VFI_PT","name":"Vertical fiscal imbalance, Percent","names":{"en":"Vertical fiscal imbalance, Percent"},"description":"A situation where there is a mismatch between the revenue-raising powers and expenditure responsibilities of different levels of government, often requiring transfers from higher to lower levels of government to address the imbalance. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"A situation where there is a mismatch between the revenue-raising powers and expenditure responsibilities of different levels of government, often requiring transfers from higher to lower levels of government to address the imbalance. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100."}},{"annotations":[],"id":"RD_PT","name":"Revenue decentralization, Percent","names":{"en":"Revenue decentralization, Percent"},"description":"The process of transferring revenue-generating powers from central to local governments to enhance local financial autonomy. A ratio expressed as a fraction of 100.","descriptions":{"en":"The process of transferring revenue-generating powers from central to local governments to enhance local financial autonomy.
